My build.xml can compile the project source  and the junit test source.

I think I have all of the properties and files available:
test-var:
     [echo] HOME=D:/JAVADevEnv/Source
     [echo] SDKS_HOME=D:/JAVADevEnv/SDKs
     [echo] JAVA_HOME=D:/JAVADevEnv/SDKs/j2sdk-1_4_2_04-windows-i586
     [echo] TOOLS_HOME=D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools
     [echo] ANT_HOME=D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/apache-ant-1.6.2
     [echo] JUNIT_HOME=D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/JUnit/junit3.8.1
     [echo] tools.jar.available=true
     [echo] ant-junit.jar.available=true
     [echo] junit.jar.available=true
     [echo] test-var  complete!

I think the ant-junit.jar is complete  (72KB   7/16/04 8:53AM)

I would expect that this version of ant would have the junit task defined.

This is the junit task that fails:

  <target name="unit-test" depends="test-var">

    <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="no" >

    </junit>

    <echo>junit-run complete!</echo>
 </target>

I would appreciate any help.

                Clark Anderson
